back.definition: Documented trail de evidence. Who collected, when, where, how stored, who accessed. Legal admissibility requires unbroken chain.
back.example: Disk image: SHA256 hash at collection = verification later. USB write blocker to prevent tampering. Signed logs. Court will reject evidence con broken chain.

back.definition: Bit-for-bit copy de storage. Preserva deleted files, slack space, metadata. Never analyze original - work on copy. Tools: FTK Imager, dd, EnCase.
back.example: Target breach: Image POS terminals antes de analysis. Original evidence preserved. DD command con hash verification.

back.definition: Analyze RAM. Volatile data: running processes, network connections, encryption keys, credentials. Gone on shutdown. Capture ASAP.
back.example: Volatility framework. BlackPOS lived in RAM scraping cards. Memory dump would show malicious process. Colonial: Should NOT power off for this reason.

back.definition: Reconstruct events chronologically. File system timestamps (MAC: Modified, Accessed, Created), log entries, registry changes. Determine sequence.
back.example: Target: When did breach start? Fazio credentials first use → Malware deployment → First card stolen → Discovery. Timeline = story.

unlock_content.title: First Steps
points: Identify: What systems compromised? What data?
Photograph: Take photos of screen, cables, physical setup
Document: Notes with timestamps. Who did what when.
Preserve: Power on? Leave as-is. Capture RAM if still on.
Chain of custody: Start documentation trail immediately.
unlock_content.bonus_fact: DO NOT power off ransomware-infected system until RAM captured. Encryption keys in memory.

unlock_content.title: Data Collection
points: Order of volatility: RAM → Network connections → Running processes → Disk → Logs → Archives
Live response: Capture volatile data before shutdown.
Disk imaging: Bit-for-bit copy with hash verification
Network capture: PCAPs if ongoing attack
Cloud: API-based collection, snapshots
unlock_content.bonus_fact: Mobile devices: Airplane mode immediately. Prevent remote wipe commands.

unlock_content.title: Deep Dive
points: File system analysis: Deleted files recovery, hidden data
Log analysis: Event logs, web logs, database logs
Malware analysis: Static (strings, metadata) + Dynamic (sandbox)
Registry forensics (Windows): Persistence, user activity
Timeline reconstruction: Piece together sequence of events
unlock_content.bonus_fact: Anti-forensics techniques: Attackers timestomp, clear logs, encrypt. Hunter must adapt.

unlock_content.title: Documentation
points: Executive summary: What happened, impact, recommendations
Technical details: Tools used, findings, evidence location
Timeline: Visual representation of attack
Chain of custody: Append to report
Legal language: May be used in court or regulatory response
unlock_content.bonus_fact: Good forensics report = clear, reproducible, legally sound. Technical pero understandable.

content.question: ¿Por qué forensic imaging antes de analysis?

options.text: Más rápido analizar image que original
options.feedback: Incorrecto. Performance no es la razón principal.

options.text: Preservar original evidence. Analysis puede alterar data. Chain of custody.
options.feedback: CORRECTO! 1) Preserve original: Any analysis alters timestamps, access logs. Original must remain pristine. 2) Chain of custody: Original stored securely. Work on verified copy. 3) Repeatability: Multiple analysts can work on separate copies. 4) Legal: Court requires original untampered. Hash verification proves copy integrity. Analogy: Crime scene photos - don't disturb crime scene, work from photos.

options.text: Backups son más fáciles de analizar
options.feedback: Incorrecto. No es sobre backups sino evidence integrity.
